text: Ditrigona derocina is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Felix Bryk in 1943. It is found in Myanmar. The wingspan is 15–17 mm for males and 17.5–19 mm for females. The wings are white where scaled, but largely colourless and semi-transparent., 1968: A taxonomic revision of the genus Ditrigona (Lepidoptera: Drepanidae: Drepaninae). The Transactions of the Zoological Society of London Volume 31, Issue 4; Abstract: A taxonomic revision of the genus Ditrigona (Lepidoptera: Drepanidae: Drepaninae) ==References== Category:Moths described in 1943 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of Myanmar Category:Taxa named by Felix Bryk
title: Ditrigona derocina
